intro: Spergularia andina, commonly known as Andean sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, succulent leaves and pink or purple flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Spergularia andina is often found in alpine meadows and is a hardy species that can withstand harsh climatic conditions.
